p: A “tort” is some act (or failing to act) that results in injury or harm to another, and amounts to a civil wrong for which courts impose liability (LII 2021). A toxic tort concerns claims of injury caused by exposure to toxins and may involve several potential defendants that brought about the exposure. Toxic tort cases resemble tort actions taken up against greenhouse gas emitters, because in both cases multiple causal factors are in play and pinning down causal responsibility and legal liability is a challenge (Burger et al. 2020).
